moves.1. e4: My opponent played the rather common e4- but
moves.2. d4: at this point i felt in a much weaker position, white had much more control of the center
moves.3. d5: white played as most people would
moves.3... Nce7: this forced my knight back, making my opening slightly weaker
moves.4. c4: white simply keeps pushing those pawns
moves.4... Ng6: ah! I spotted Ng6 as a way to start a better attack as well as free my pieces more
moves.5. Nc3: quite boring and expected move in my opinion
moves.7. fxe3: however i pulled out better from that position because white's pawn island is slightly weaker (double pawn)
moves.8... Nh4: I was trying to get a bit fancier
moves.10. gxf3: what else could one expect from white then!
moves.13. Kc2: i wasn't sure why white played that except from maybe wanting to get its rook out and doing an artificial castling
moves.13... O-O-O: i'm now bringing my rook into action
moves.14. b4: pushing pawns on the side i castled- usually a good idea
moves.15. c5: the fight has only just begun
moves.15... Ne8: it may seem odd but i felt that my knight was absolutely useless in its previous spot
moves.16... dxc5: ah, now i take the bait
moves.17... Qe7: i make my queen more useful
moves.18. Bb5: he is deterrmine to play on the offence
moves.18... Qxc5: but that was a slight blunder
moves.19. Rgc1: white now attempts to get a sneaky attempt of attack on my queen
moves.19... Nd6: i may only be a pawn up but it will make all the difference neccessary
moves.20... Qb4: i say no no to that
moves.22. Qb2: what's white up to now- still developing pieces?
moves.23. Nxb5: white has fallen for the trap
moves.23... Qxa4+: i'm by more than one pawn now!
moves.25... Nxb5: I don't have an any better move
moves.26. Rxb5: white's most probable best move- unless both me and my opponent are missing something:)
moves.27. Rcb1: not his cup of tea though
moves.27... b6: but i'm not taking any of that!
moves.28. Rc1: He seemed to have made a rather random move to me!
moves.28... Rhd8: but i want to attack now
moves.29. Rc6: is he trying to prevent c6??
moves.30... f5: now my chance to push pawns
moves.31... gxf5: i'm not to be left behind
moves.32. Rh4: playing agressive if it is possible in chess
moves.32... a6: if he is attacking so am i!
moves.33. Rb2: I would say that is a fatal error on white's part
moves.33... Rd6xd5: it leads on to something elese later on in the game
moves.35... Rg8: Oooh-will white notice the threat of losing the other rook!...
moves.37... Rg7g1: now i'm going for the mate
moves.38... Rg8g2+: or did he also create a new problem??
moves.40. Kc3: king in the open- a bit too far from the proper end game
moves.40... Re1: still- i felt like picking off those pawns
moves.41... Rge2: however, i force white to agree!
moves.46. Rd5: where is that rook going- i had considered Rd1+ but luckily i noticed the mistake in time!
moves.46... a4: instead i decided to go for the queen!
moves.47... a3: but i'm not giving up on my queen
moves.48. Rdb8+: i don't see the point in that
moves.49. Rh6+: what is white really trying to do???
moves.49... Kb5 50. Rc8: now white is after my pawn
moves.51. Rxc7: yes- white fell for the trick
moves.54. Rcxb6: what is white up to now
moves.54... Re2+: something that won't help now (forced mate)

gameName: A game i thoroughly enjoyed playing!
